name: Arts Hotel

reviews.text: A wonderful location in Paddington - lots of interesting shops, next door to a new/2nd hand bookshop that stays open until midnight. Just outside is a bus stop with frequent buses to Circular Quay and Bondi Beach, and several places to eat, a 7-11 etc.
reviews.title: In the heart of Sydney

reviews.text: Friendly staff, let us into our room early (10am), clean, comfortable room with a mini-fridge and a safe. It wasn't the weather for the pool, but it looked great. Free internet access from the terminal in reception and a useful laundry room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Excellent value for money for Sydney - a short walk from the Saturday Paddington market.
reviews.title: Value for money

likes.liked: — Quiet location away from the hustle of the city
likes.disliked: — Road noise at rooms in front of the property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great hotel, with exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. They made us feel very welcome from start to finish. Rooms were very clean and tidy, and the maid always left us little chocolates on our pillow each nite!! Free internet access was very useful, and they had a laundry room and a lovely little pool and decking area. The hotel is situated ideally at one end of Oxford street, so you have all the attractions just a short walk away, but cannot hear the hustle and bustle. Would definately recommmend this hotel to others and would certainly stay there again!!
reviews.title: Nice touches

likes.liked: — No small annoyances like in many hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked with the hotel directly after reading reviews. They communicated effectively through emails. We decided on the hotel not knowing anything about Sydney and found it to be good value for money. We walked to the CBD a couple of times and caught the bus which was cheap and regular other times. Not much going on locally but the CBD is very close.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Good location, free parking, very friendly reception staff who gave us lots of tips and advice on public transport and was very helpful with all questions we had.
reviews.title: Smelly room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Our room (it was room 113, so you can avoid it) stank of urine; it got a little better once we activated ventilation and the air conditioner, but a/c is automatically switched off once you leave the room so it does not help much. The room was very small as well and it was not perfectly clean. There was rubbish left from a previous guest in the trash bin.
reviews.title: Allright hotel
Well located, clean, simple, does the job
reviews.text: There is free internet access from a computer in the lobby, but it was almost always occupied since there is only one for such a big hotel.
For Sydney, it is however probably one of the hotels with reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Does the job!

likes.liked: — Free wireless hotel wide, free bike use

reviews.text: One last advice would be to avoid the airport shuttle which the hotel can book for you. When we were picked up, we were driven to another hotel and had to wait there for another vehicle for quite a time. It took much longer than we were told.
reviews.title: Good Value & Unfussy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location for exploring Sydney and surrounding area - very convenient to buses and great for walking - easy & quick access to town, ferries and Bondi and other southern beaches in the other direction.
reviews.title: Loved Sullivans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful staff. Appreciated the free internet access as well as the laundry facilities.
reviews.title: Satisfying Stay

likes.disliked: — No air conditioning in the restaurant and it was too hot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were simple and clean - more than adequate for our use - we were not spending the day in the room while in Sydney.
reviews.title: Good Location, Good Value
Perfect Location in Paddington
reviews.text: We appreciated the pool after a hot day of exploring Sydney.

We stayed 2 nights at Sullivans on a precruise visit to Sydney. The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful. There is a bus stop just a block up and the public transportation into the CBD is very good. The continental breakfast is $14.90. It was a bit of a surprise since we get it free usually in the USA. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Place For The Money!!!

reviews.text: Feel a bit mean only giving it a 2 rating but i was quite disappointed. We had 2 room on the side of the building, maybe if we'd had one of the internal rooms overlooking the garden it may have been better. The rooms we had looked very tired. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was spotless but the windows looked old and the curtains were really shabby. the nets were gray and in one room there was a horrible yellow stain on them. There's really no excuse for that, it doesnt cost a lot to put clean nets up. We could hear the noise of the traffic, I think it was only single glazing. The bathroom was adequate and clean but again, dated. The pool is freezing because it's "solar heated", which doesnt mean solar panel heated, just solar heated, sadly it is built in the shade apart from a few hours sun in the morning so that pool will never be warm. The blue paint has been eroded by the chemicals and comes off on your body! We told the staff and they closed the pool, yet another disappointment. I dont think it's great value for money as it wasnt THAT cheap and i wish we'd paid a few hundred more quid for a better experience. Gladly we were only there 4 nights. It wasnt awful but it wasnt great either. We ate breakfast at Alexandras opposite the park just a quick bus ride away. Another fab place to eat breakfast is past alexandras opposite the Shark Hotel at a place called K.K's they served delicious breakfasts including luxury muslis with homemade exotic yoghurts and fresh fruit as well as an abundance of baked goods for a fraction of what it costs to eat at the hotel. We also bought the week long orange travel pass that allows you to use the buses and the ferries as often as you wish. This worked out to be a great money saver, we certainly got our money's worth. I'd recommend forgetting about the explorer buses as they cost loads and just using the ordinary transport system on an orange saver card.
reviews.title: Bit Disappointed.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights on our way home from NZ. After staying in "budget" hotels in NZ, this was a step up. Our room was small but clean & in good order, not at all shabby. The A/C worked well and we needed it as it was quite warm. Our garden room looked over the small pool and a lovely small garden & fountain. Very pleasant & quiet. No street noise at all. The bathroom was clean. They are a bit stingy with towels - no wash clothes or hand towels only one bath towel per person & a shower soap dispenser. Bring your own shampoo, etc. as there are no complimentaries. There is a tea/coffee service with a small chocolate candy. There is a small frig. but don't ask for extra ice as there is no ice maker. The 380 bus leaves from the hotel door going to Bondi Beach or town. We walked in & out of town as we are walkers but it might be a trek for those who aren't. There are several good restaurants & pubs in the area & the hotel provides an excellent guide to them in each room. Going into Paddington there are loads of stylish boutiques. Walking into town, one goes past a couple of strip clubs, fetish shops & through Taylor Sq. known for its gay population. During the day, the area feels safe but we refrained from being out too late in the area. We suspect there is a reason the doors are locked after hours. As to the reception, there were a number of different men there during our stay. One in particular was a friendly, no nonsense person while the others did seem to ignore us as we came and left. However, when a couple of unusual fellows came in off the street and started to walk upstairs, they were called back and questioned. I believe reception contacted whomever they were looking for and had them come down. At 15$ for a continental breakfast, we did not have breakfast there but found cheaper breakfasts elsewhere or just had excellent large, flat whites & huge raisin toasts for $5 at the stand outside the Marriot across from Hyde Park. Sullivan's Hotel's webpage clearly & accurately depicts the hotel.
reviews.title: Great stay!

likes.liked: — Well run and well kept hotel. Good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A little bit tired looking but or room was at the end of a corridor so nice and quiet. We picked this hotel because they were in a good location for mardis gras and "relatively" inexpensive.
reviews.title: Nice budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is nice, on a major bus route easy access to downtown. The staff however is another issue. Most were not friendly at all. The night time staff would not even speak or acknowledge your presence. The reason you have to inter act with then is you need to be buzzed in, because of thier key system. Also one wonders about security as the same night staff seemed as if they would give you any any key you asked for. I would not stay on a return to Sydney, have found much nicer staff else where.
reviews.title: Poor Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 10 nights in December and found the hotel to be excellent. The staff at reception were incredibly knowledgeable and friendly.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

description: The Arts Hotel is a charming 3 star hotel offering personal service and a unique location in Paddington, Sydney's arts and fashion precinct. All rooms have ensuite, air conditioning, free Foxtel, safe, ironing facilities, bar fridge, hairdryer and clock radio. Garden rooms face onto the central courtyard and have complimentary wi-fi. Interconnecting rooms are available for families with children. There is free wi-fi in all public areas of the hotel, free guest bicycles and free car parking (NB space is limited and cannot be reserved).Set amongst fashion boutiques, specialty shops, cinemas, late night bookshops, art galleries, pubs, cafes and restaurants, the hotel is also within walking distance of the city. Buses run directly to City shops, Circular Quay, Central Station, Bondi Beach and Watsons Bay. Paddington is a heritage conservation area with a village atmosphere. It is a delight to explore on foot with its narrow winding streets and restored Victorian terraces houses. There are over 280 boutiques in Paddington and on Saturdays you can visit Sydney's most popular street market.The Arts Hotel is the perfect base from which to explore Sydney. We invite you to experience the charm.
